title: Lactantius typeface ????
content:
Lactantius typeface ????

Hello just Reading wikipedia, but i remember it also being mentioned in, Roxane Juberts “Typography and Graphic design from Antiquity to the Present” im just wondering what it looks like..i tried searching the internet to no prevail and no one seemes to have mentioned it on here before!! ok cheers.

———-

[www.markandrewwebber.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203204015/http:/www.markandrewwebber.com/ "www.markandrewwebber.com")

 [‹ Oblique typeface from HeartSupport.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203204015/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41774 "Go to previous forum topic") [Super Design Market ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203204015/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41770 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dexter121uk

comments.content:
I wonder if [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203204015/http:/web.archive.org/web/20010121204600/webcom.net/~nfhome/roman2.htm) is close. I found that Conrad Sweynheym published the “Opera” of Lactintius. Then the linked article claims this typeface was “the first truly Roman typeface”, and was designed by him in 1468.

[edit: ’Opera’ is plural of ’opus’ which means ’work’, as I understand it.]

- Mike Yanega

Sweynheym and Pannartz printed Lactantius twice (1465 in Subiaco, 1468 in Rome) using two different typeface. The latter is something like [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203204015/http:/www.ndl.go.jp/incunabula/e/collection/incu_32_01.html) or Mike’s link, while the former has more gothic features. I can’t find any picture on Google.

cool cheers guys for your help!

TYPOGRAPHY !!!!!!!!!!!  
Mark Webber ISTD  
 [www.dexter121uk.devaiantart.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203204015/http:/www.dexter121uk.devaiantart.com/ "www.dexter121uk.devaiantart.com")
